title: Qual scoring logs broken with drcsim-nightly?

content.raw:
I have done qual task 1 using


```
#!

drcsim-nightly 2.5.2~hg20130509r844cd73465a0-1~precise
gazebo-nightly 1.7.3~hg20130509r096ec69b95be-1~precise
```

and think I have done everything according to instructions. Playing back the state.log file works (even if it gets extremly slow with time, so I didn't play it back to the end so far). When I run the mkqual.sh script I get tons of these errors:


```
#!

Warning [parser.cc:427] Unable to parse sdf element[]
Error [parser.cc:337] parse as sdf version 1.4 failed, should try to parse as old deprecated format
Error [SDF.cc:993] Unable to find value for key[world_name]
Error [SDF.cc:1185] Unable to find value for key[sim_time]
Error [SDF.cc:1185] Unable to find value for key[wall_time]
Error [SDF.cc:1185] Unable to find value for key[real_time]
Warning [parser.cc:499] XML Attribute[version] in element[sdf] not defined in SDF, ignoring.
Error [parser.cc:719] XML Element[state], child of element[sdf] not defined in SDF. Ignoring.[]
Warning [parser.cc:427] Unable to parse sdf element[]
Error [parser.cc:337] parse as sdf version 1.4 failed, should try to parse as old deprecated format
Error [SDF.cc:993] Unable to find value for key[world_name]
Error [SDF.cc:1185] Unable to find value for key[sim_time]
Error [SDF.cc:1185] Unable to find value for key[wall_time]
Error [SDF.cc:1185] Unable to find value for key[real_time]
Warning [parser.cc:499] XML Attribute[version] in element[sdf] not defined in SDF, ignoring.
```

Eventually, the script will finish, but the generated state.log seems to be broken, as the robot does not move when trying to play it back using Gazebo. Any hints would be appreciated.
content.html:
I have done qual task 1 using

drcsim-nightly 2.5.2~hg20130509r844cd73465a0-1~precise
gazebo-nightly 1.7.3~hg20130509r096ec69b95be-1~precise

and think I have done everything according to instructions. Playing back the state.log file works (even if it gets extremly slow with time, so I didn't play it back to the end so far). When I run the mkqual.sh script I get tons of these errors:

Warning [parser.cc:427] Unable to parse sdf element[]
Error [parser.cc:337] parse as sdf version 1.4 failed, should try to parse as old deprecated format
Error [SDF.cc:993] Unable to find value for key[world_name]
Error [SDF.cc:1185] Unable to find value for key[sim_time]
Error [SDF.cc:1185] Unable to find value for key[wall_time]
Error [SDF.cc:1185] Unable to find value for key[real_time]
Warning [parser.cc:499] XML Attribute[version] in element[sdf] not defined in SDF, ignoring.
Error [parser.cc:719] XML Element[state], child of element[sdf] not defined in SDF. Ignoring.[]
Warning [parser.cc:427] Unable to parse sdf element[]
Error [parser.cc:337] parse as sdf version 1.4 failed, should try to parse as old deprecated format
Error [SDF.cc:993] Unable to find value for key[world_name]
Error [SDF.cc:1185] Unable to find value for key[sim_time]
Error [SDF.cc:1185] Unable to find value for key[wall_time]
Error [SDF.cc:1185] Unable to find value for key[real_time]
Warning [parser.cc:499] XML Attribute[version] in element[sdf] not defined in SDF, ignoring.

Eventually, the script will finish, but the generated state.log seems to be broken, as the robot does not move when trying to play it back using Gazebo. Any hints would be appreciated.
